thread.title: Inflation won't hit 2% anytime soon: ECB's Knot
thread.title_full: Inflation won't hit 2% anytime soon: ECB's Knot | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Inflation won't hit 2% anytime soon: ECB's Knot
text:
The European Central Bank will likely need more time to reach its inflation rate target of just below 2 per cent, ECB governing council member Klaas Knot said in an interview with Dutch newspaper Het Financieele Dagblad released on Thursday.
"There is nothing wrong with the target of 2 per cent, but the medium term over which we aim to achieve that, is probably a bit longer than it was in the past," Mr Knot, who also heads the Dutch central bank, was Quote: d as saying. "Clearly, we will not be back at 2 per cent inflation within one and a half year."
If the ECB doesn't succeed in raising inflation toward its target within 18 months, odds are that the central bank will extend its current monthly €60 billion ($US67.57 billion) asset-purchasing program, dubbed quantitative easing, or QE. The ECB rolled out the program in March 2015 to avoid a deflation scenario for the euro area and initially planned for it to run until September 2016.
The Dutch central banker said it was too early to speculate on whether he would support an extension of the program, according to the interview.
"I would like to point out that only a third of the program has been executed. We still have more than €700 billion of asset purchases to go. It is in the interest of everyone to allow the current program to be as effective as it can," the newspaper Quote: d Mr Knot as saying.
